golem 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

  • Changelog

Return the loss of a golem model

Source: R/score.R
score.Rd

This function is a unified interface to return various types of loss for a model fit with golem().

score(object, x, y, measure)

# S3 method for GolemGaussian
score(object, x, y, measure = c("deviance",
  "mse", "mae"))

# S3 method for GolemBinomial
score(object, x, y, measure = c("deviance",
  "mse", "mae", "misclass_error", "auc"))

Arguments

object

an object of class "Golem"
x

feature matrix
y

response
measure

type of target measure. The default, "deviance", returns mean squared error for Gaussian models and deviance for Binomial models. "mse" returns mean squared error. "mae" returns mean absolute error, and "auc" returns Area Under the Curve.

Value

The measure along the regularization path depending on the value in measure.

Examples

x <- subset(infert, select = c("induced", "age", "pooled.stratum"))
y <- infert$case

fit <- golem(x, y, family = "binomial")
score(fit, x, y, measure = "auc")
#>        p1        p2        p3        p4        p5        p6        p7        p8
